review: This and the PaperWhite Kindle are the best items we have ever purchased from Amazon. We dumped our cable TV more than a year ago. The Amazon fire TV brings in clearly, wirelessly, Amazon, Hulu, Netflix and others, a host of apps and games.  We dont miss our cable connection At ALL and certainly enjoy the $100+/mo savings.
author: Amazon Customer "Capri142"

review: The Amazon Fire works great.  Simple to install.  The only problem I have is slow internet connection thru my WiFi.  That is a Verizon issue
author: Jordan  Luciano "Jordan Luciano"

review: Works great! It is fast and easy to use with a variety of uses. I know longer need cable.
author: Steven M. Bell "music7x3"

review: I called at one point for some help, but apparently on the week-ends the phones are outsourced to somewhere else in the world and the people just use a script.  This a big learning curve for me with no instructions and so far I can access nothing (so far) without paying extra.  It says all those things are included, but I have yet to find out how.Most of the times when I have taken the time to sit down and try to access things it says HOME is not available and nothing else on the menu is available either and yet it says I have a very good connection to WiFi.  It's very difficult to try to learn how to use it when nothing is available for you to see.  I am now sure it is not just all me.
author: Joanne

review: Loving the ease of use and access to many other  resources (Netflix, YouTube, etc.). Best birthday present I've received in ages!
author: A. Kreinbrook

review: My roku died, and I  should have gone back with it. I miss being able to add content that isn't on the installed menu, but I do like the voice control on fire so it's almost a wash, with the roku 1 star higher IMO
author: jeff wright

review: Decent concept, but slow, takes to much time to download new content. Going to be selling it cheap on eBay and sticking with my Apple TV.
author: Mik
